sentences.en: ‘Sit!’ he said, and the dog obeyed him instantly.
sentences.cn: “坐下！”他说道，那只狗马上就服从了。

sentences.en: All I had to do now was to obey him in silence.
sentences.cn: 这时,我要做的只是默默地服从他.

sentences.en: Clifford's only stipulation is that his clients obey his advice.
sentences.cn: 克利福德唯一的要求就是客户必须听从他的建议。

sentences.en: He swore to obey the king.
He threatened to disinherit her if she refused to obey.
sentences.cn: 他威胁说如果她拒绝服从就剥夺她的继承权。

sentences.en: Hope you will obey and do accordingly.
I was threatened with a beating if I didn't obey.
sentences.cn: 如果我不服从,他扬言要打我.

sentences.en: It was still Baker's duty to obey.
The little boy made no effort to obey.
They had to obey the decree that beards be shaved off.
sentences.cn: 他们只得服从剃光胡须的法令.

sentences.en: They obey the one unwritten rule that binds them all—no talking.
sentences.cn: 他们都遵守着那条约束他们所有人的默认规则——要守口如瓶。

sentences.en: Will you kindly obey the instructions I am about to give?
sentences.cn: 劳驾你服从我要给出的指令好不好？

sentences.en: You should reason with him instead of just telling him to obey.
sentences.cn: 你应该同他讲清道理,不要只叫他听话.

trans.tran_en: to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do
to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do
